text: Alexander Abusch (1966). Alexander Abusch (14 February, 1902 27 January, 1982). He was a German journalist, non-fiction writer, and politician. According to one source he was born into a Jewish family in Kraków, Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria, Austria-Hungary. According to another source, he was born in Nuremberg,Cross-Section: Anthology of the PEN Centre German Democratic Republic Edition Leipzig, 1970. p. 18. where, in the suburb of Gostenhof, he grew up, attended school, served his apprenticeship and had his first full- time job. His father worked as a Coachman and scrap metal dealer, and later opened a hat shop. His mother also worked as a small trader. Abusch joined the Communist Party of Germany (KPD) in 1918. He was editor of several KPD publications. In 1937, he became part of the exiled KPD leadership in Paris, later in Toulouse. In 1941, he moved to Mexico, where he became a member of the Free Germany Movement. Between 1948 and 1950 he was part of the party leadership of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany. Between 1958 and 1961 he served as Minister of Culture of the German Democratic Republic (East Germany)."Abusch, Alexander (1902-1982)". Das Bundesarchiv (German Federal Archives). 2004-2005. Retrieved 16 October 2009. It was in his role as Minister of Culture that he ordered the demolition of princely castle of Putbus on Rügen, which was considered the most beautiful in Mecklenburg- Western Pomerania.Ralph Sommer, Verein will Schloss Putbus auf Rügen wieder aufbauen, Nordkurier, 8 December 2019 He published under the pen name Ernst Reinhardt. == References == Category:1902 births Category:1982 deaths Category:20th-century German politicians Category:Communist Party of Germany politicians Category:Members of the Central Committee of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany Category:Cultural Association of the GDR members Category:Government ministers of East Germany Category:Members of the Volkskammer Category:People of the Stasi Category:German male writers Category:National Committee for a Free Germany members Category:Recipients of the Order of Karl Marx Category:Recipients of the Patriotic Order of Merit (honor clasp) Category:Recipients of the National Prize of East Germany Category:Jewish socialists Category:German expatriates in Mexico Category:Jewish emigrants from Nazi Germany to France Category:Polish Jews Category:Jews from Galicia (Eastern Europe) Category:People from the Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria Category:Journalists from Kraków Category:Politicians from Kraków
